 So, now we see the hypocracy of the situation.

 Well, first of all, I have to go on the record and say that I really don't think this thread belongs in the religion forum. If EZ thinks tacking on the word God somehow makes it a religion discussion, I question his sanity (not that I didn't already). But, until this thread is moved, I will give the response I promised.
 
 First of all, we must take into account that it was the US itself that laid the foundations for their nuclear programme. Around 1957, after a CIA-supported coup, the US established a civil nuclear co-operative programme under the U.S. Atoms for Peace programme, so, if anyone is to blame for all of these fears we seem to have - mainly brought on by paranoid and warmongering Bush, it is us as a nation (just as we were really to blame for the whole "WMD" fiasco in Iraq - another example of an irrational fear).
 
 Next we must take into account the need to prove that Iran is actually developing nuclear weapons - something that I believe is rather unlikely.
 
 I believe that they should absolutely be allowed to build and use nuclear power plants. I believe the US should attempt to take a more involved role in it - as obvious child suggested, provide them the help and materials to build the power plants in exchange for receiving the spent fuel. 
 
 Also I would say that the UN should be given more power than it has, so that it can actually enforce its sanctions of Iran and other places - I think the US has been rather brutish in their disregard for the UN, something that has led to its low repute among other countries, and that is something that also needs to change if we expect to have any sort of support from other nations. 
 
 I also do not think that we should in any respect start yet another war. We've learned the hard way with Iraq at the cost of our soldier's lives. Attacking Iran would also lower our already low reputation among other nations, something that has already been done rather "wonderfully" by our present warmongering administration. 
 
 As most of the others said, it is better that we be reactive rather than pro-active. 
 
 Iran certainly has the right to develop their nuclear power under the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty. They are on record that they only wish to use their uranium for that purpose, and as there is no proof of their intention or capabilities otherwise, I take them at their word.
 
 As to nuclear weapons, I believe that the US and the other nuclear powers of the world must also stick to the treaty, and not give such weapons to other nations - to do otherwise would be foolish.
 
 Again, the US must become more involved in this, supplying aid to Iran to build power plants, and they should not listen to warmongering people like Bush.
 
 
 Now, EZ, how about your views on what we should do? Or are you going to evade your own question like you do with everyone else's?
